title.value: Оптимизация сроков сева и норм высева семян озимой пшеницы в связи с потеплением климата
Optimization of sowing terms and seeding rates of winter wheat seeds due to climate warming

journal.title: Arable Farming and Breeding in Belarus : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Satsyuk, I.V., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Scientific and Practical Center for  Arable Farming

abstract.value: In course of three year researches there was studied the effect of sowing terms and seeding rates on the yield of winter wheat (Triticum aestivum) var. Legenda. The researches were realized in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus in 2008-2011 on the trial fields of Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Minsk region) in a selection crop rotation. The retrospective analysis showed that under warming climate in autumn, in Minsk region, sowing of winter wheat should be begun on the 6th of September (Myadel district) and finished on the 22nd of September in (Luban district), and in Grodno region, sowing should be conducted from the 9th of September (Oshmyany district) to the 22nd of September (Volkovysk district). The seeding rate recommended was 3.5-4.0 million of germinable seeds per hectare. The interaction of weather conditions, the timing of planting and seeding rates provided 40.7% of the variability of yields. Climate warming caused the displacement of optimum sowing of winter wheat in the second agro-climatic zone in the later period of 6-9 days, providing a 75% probability of leaving in the winter in the tillering stage, increasing by 5-15% of field overwintering of plants, the formation of the highest possible yield in accordance with the applicable technology of cultivation.
